poem:
Title: "Injustice in January"

No conviction, despite the reddened snow,
Witness the policeman's tainted halo.
Brighton nights whisper secrets untold,
A dark parody of justice unfolds.
On holiday they feast, the wolves unchained,
In a play of power, insipid, unrestrained.
Menaced by silence, the city laments,
For the sad tune of a life, unsentenced.
